raw_comment:
1)In all three categories, young women reach out to their parents significantly more in comparison to young males. The least popular method of reaching out to parents was visiting in person while the most popular method was sending texts. The smallest difference between young men and women was in the visiting in person category. 

2)I wonder how far the survey participants lived from their parents? Do jobs and college affect the methods of participants reaching out? 

3)In my community I know a lot of people around my age that plan on going to college. Depending on future plans some people plan on going to college nearby or going out of state. So, it is interesting to see that one day we may fit into one of these categories depending on what path in life we take. 

4)Staying Connected : How Today's Youth Keep Their Parents Involved
ace_sentences: In all three categories, young women reach out to their parents more than young men.
Visiting parents in person is the least popular method of reaching out to parents.
Sending texts to parents is the most popular method of reaching out to parents.
The difference between young men and young women is smallest in the category of visiting in person.
I wonder how far the survey participants live from their parents.
I wonder whether jobs affect the methods that participants use to reach out to their parents.
I wonder whether college affects the methods that participants use to reach out to their parents.
In my community, I know many people around my age.
Many of these people plan to go to college.
Some people plan to go to a college near their home.
Some people plan to go to a college in another state.
In the future, we may fit into one of these categories.
This depends on the path in life that we take.
The headline is: Staying Connected: How Today's Youth Keep Their Parents Involved.
